title: Chicken schnitzel with sweet and sour cabbage

ingredients.item: ¼ essential white cabbage, cored and shredded
½ x 20g pack dill, fronds chopped, a few reserved

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to 200˚C, gas mark 6. Put each chicken breast between 2 pieces of baking parchment and bash with a rolling pin until evenly flattened and about 1cm thick. Tip the breadcrumbs onto a plate and the flour onto another plate; season the flour. Crack the egg into a small bowl and beat with a fork. Dip the chicken in the flour to coat completely, then dip in the egg and finally the breadcrumbs. Chill in the fridge until ready to cook.
Put the whole potato into a pan of boiling salted water. Cook for 20-25 minutes until tender to the point of a knife. Drain, peel, then mash with the butter and milk; season and keep warm.

Meanwhile, heat 1 tsp oil in a frying pan and fry the breaded chicken for 1-2 minutes on each side until golden. Transfer to a baking tray and bake for 15 minutes, until cooked through, the juices run clear and no pink meat remains. Meanwhile, return the frying pan to the heat, add the remaining 1 tsp oil, the caraway seeds and cabbage; season. Fry, stirring, for 5 minutes, until the cabbage has softened a little. Add the vinegar, sugar and 5 tbsp water; cook for 2 minutes, then stir through the dill. Set aside and chill 1 chicken breast; serve the other with the mashed potato and sweet and sour cabbage, sprinkled with the reserved dill fronds.
